title: Jingles

properties.name: description
properties.value: Jingles are short tracks played during specific occasions, such as completing a quest, levelling up, or winning a minigame.

content:
For longer unlisted pieces of music, see Unlisted music tracks.

Jingles are short tracks played during specific occasions, such as completing a quest, levelling up, or winning a minigame.

Jingles will play on top of default music, and the Music Player will display the name of the previous track that was playing. As such, jingles have no name that is visible in-game.

Old School RuneScape music player

Contents

  • 1 Level up jingles
    • 1.1 Standard
    • 1.2 Special
  • 2 Random event jingles
  • 3 Minigame jingles
  • 4 POH jingles
  • 5 Achievement Diary jingles
  • 6 Quest jingles
  • 7 Other jingles
  • 8 Unused jingles

Level up jingles[edit | edit source]

Level up jingles play whenever a player levels up their skills. Each skill, excluding Agility, typically have two distinct jingles for normal level ups, and level ups that unlock new content for the player. However, not all skills follow this convention, and play under different circumstances.

Standard[edit | edit source]

These skills have two distinct jingles: One for normal level ups, and level ups that unlock new content for the player.

Skill Normal With unlocks
Attack Play track Play track
Cooking Play track Play track
Crafting Play track Play track
Defence Play track Play track
Farming Play track Play track
Firemaking Play track Play track
Fishing Play track Play track
Fletching Play track Play track
Herblore Play track Play track
Magic Play track Play track
Mining Play track Play track
Prayer Play track Play track
Ranged Play track Play track
Runecraft Play track Play track
Slayer Play track Play track
Smithing Play track[1] Play track
Thieving Play track Play track
Woodcutting Play track Play track
  1. ^ The normal Smithing level up jingle is never played. This is because every level unlocks content, and so the jingle for unlocking content is used for the entire skill. In the past, the normal level up jingle was played at levels 45, 47, 65, and 67 due to those levels having no new content to unlock. However, after 7 January 2016, these levels unlocked smithing various tiers of Shayzien supply armour and thus now use the jingle for unlocking content.

Special[edit | edit source]

These skills, excluding Agility, have two distinct jingles depending on which level the player attains.

Skill Jingle Level up condition
Agility Play track Normal
Construction Play track Normal
Play track Every 10 levels
Hitpoints Play track Levels 11-49
Play track Levels 50-99
Hunter Play track Even-numbered levels
Play track Odd-numbered levels
Strength Play track Levels 2-49
Play track Levels 50-99

Random event jingles[edit | edit source]

These jingles are played as part of a random event.

Track Released Location
Maze complete 2 August 2004 Plays when completing the Maze random event. It is based upon Time Out.
Prison Pete success 10 January 2006 Plays when completing the Prison Pete random event. It is based upon In the Clink.
Prison Pete fail 10 January 2006 Plays when the player is unsuccessful in the Prison Pete random event. It is based upon In the Clink.
Evil Twin caught 22 May 2006 Plays when the twin is successfuly caught during the Evil twin random event. It is based upon Head to Head.
Surprise Exam complete 17 July 2007 Plays if the player completes the Surprise Exam random event. It is based upon School's Out.
Surprise Exam failure 17 July 2007 Plays if the player fails the Surprise Exam random event. It is based upon School's Out.

Achievement Diary jingles[edit | edit source]

These jingles are played when completing tasks for an Achievement Diary.

Currently, only the Karamja Diary has completion jingles for the easy, medium, and hard tasks.

Track Released Location
Karamja Diary - easy task completed 8 May 2007 Plays upon completing an easy task in the Karamja Diary.
Karamja Diary - medium task completed 8 May 2007 Plays upon completing a medium task in the Karamja Diary.
Karamja Diary - hard task completed 8 May 2007 Plays upon completing a hard task in the Karamja Diary.
Karamja Diary - all easy tasks complete 8 May 2007 Plays upon completing all easy tasks in the Karamja Diary.
Karamja Diary - all medium tasks complete 8 May 2007 Plays upon completing all medium tasks in the Karamja Diary.
Karamja Diary - all hard tasks complete 8 May 2007 Plays upon completing all hard tasks in the Karamja Diary.

King's Ransom - King Arthur is freed 24 July 2007 Plays during King's Ransom, when the player frees King Arthur from stone.

Unused jingles[edit | edit source]

These jingles are not used anywhere in-game, but exist as files in the game's code.

Track Released Location
Death 2 Before June 2004 An alternative track intended to play when the player dies.
Elf singing N/A May have been intended to play during Roving Elves.
Temple built N/A May have been intended to play when completing the temple repairs during Shades of Mort'ton.
Forgetful puzzle complete 26 July 2005 Intended to play during Forgettable Tale... upon completing the minecart puzzles. It is based upon Right on Track.
Speedy Gnome success 9 August 2005 Intended to play when successfully completing the scrapped Speedy Gnome random event. It is based upon Athlete's Foot.
Speedy Gnome failure 9 August 2005 Intended to play when failing the scrapped Speedy Gnome random event. It is based upon Athlete's Foot.
Keldagrim Trading win N/A Intended to play when winning during the scrapped Keldagrim Trading minigame. It is based upon The Trade Parade.
Keldagrim Trading loss N/A Intended to play when losing during the scrapped Keldagrim Trading minigame. It is based upon The Trade Parade.
POH Canifis theme 31 May 2006 Intended to play when entering a Player-owned house with a Canifis-themed style.
POH Lumbridge theme 31 May 2006 Intended to play when entering a Player-owned house with a Lumbridge-themed style.
Snake charming (short) 17 July 2006 Presumably intended to play during when charming a snake during Pyramid Plunder.
Surok rock 27 March 2007 May have been intended to play during What Lies Below.
Penance Queen 4 January 2007 May have been intended to play during Barbarian Assault when the Penance Queen appeared. It is based upon Pirates of Penance.

'''Jingles''' are short tracks played during specific occasions, such as completing a quest, levelling up, or winning a [[minigame]].

Jingles will play on top of default music, and the [[Music Player]] will display the name of the previous track that was playing. As such, jingles have no name that is visible in-game.

{{Playlist}}
